intro: Kosteletzkya tampicensis, commonly known as the Tampico marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Gulf of Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and salt marshes. The plant has showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are broad and succulent, adapted to retain water in brackish environments. Kosteletzkya tampicensis plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
